intro: Cucumella silentvalleyi, commonly known as the Silent Valley cucumber, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the Silent Valley region of Kerala, India. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant is characterized by its slender, vine-like structure and small, pale green, edible fruits. It thrives in the humid, tropical climate of the Western Ghats, where it plays a vital role in the local ecosystem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from environmental degradation and habitat loss.
